body.note: Python validation currently uses pyflakes to perform the validation. So in order to use eclim's python validation you will first need to install pyflakes and make sure it is in your path.
body.p: When editing a python file eclim will default to validating the file when it is written. Any errors will be added to the current window's location list (:help location-list) and their corresponding line number noted via Vim's sign functionality.
body.note: Python validation does not currently require that the file exist in an Eclipse project, but this may change in the future.
body.p: If you don't want python files validated when saving them, you can set the g:EclimPythonValidate variable described in the configuration section below.
Regardless of whether you have validation enabled upon saving or not, the following command is still available for validating xml files on demand.

ul.li:
g:EclimPythonValidate
If set to 0, disables python validation when saving the file.
